thread.title: Chilling winters in Odisha, Rourkela records the lowest 5 degree Celsius
thread.title_full: Chilling winters in Odisha, Rourkela records the lowest 5 degree Celsius

author: KalingaTV Bureau
title: Chilling winters in Odisha, Rourkela records the lowest 5 degree Celsius
text:
Bhubaneswar : As temperature is dropping, the intensity of winter chilliness is continuing to rise. However, the IMD predicted that there will be no change in the night temperature. The temperature during the day is likely to decrease by 2 to 3 degree Celsius.
The sky will remain clear over the next five to seven days. In the last 24 hours, Rourkela has recorded a dip in temperature, becoming the coldest city in Odisha. The lowest temperature was recorded at 10.2 degrees Celsius. Phulbani recorded 11 degree Celsius, while Daringbadi recorded 11.5 degree Celsius. On December 13, Mayurbhanj district has recorded the less than 5 degree Celsius. In Upper Barakamuda the temperature was recorded at 3 degrees Celsius and in Chahala 4 degrees Celsius was recorded last night.
Besides, the chilling winter, the chit chat in tea stalls can also be seen. The locals are enjoying the chilling winters with morning walks and tea sips.
Also Read: IMD Predicts Dense To Very Dense Fog And Shallow To Moderate Fog In Odisha Districts
